description: A high-level, versatile programming language known for its readability and simplicity.
A widely-used object-oriented language designed for portability and performance.
The primary language for client-side web development, enabling interactive web pages.
A dynamic, open-source language known for simplicity and used in the Rails framework.
A server-side scripting language mainly used for web development.
The standard markup language used to create and structure content on the web.
A stylesheet language used to control the presentation and layout of HTML documents.
A modern, object-oriented programming language developed by Microsoft for .NET development.
A TypeScript-based web application framework developed by Google.
A statically typed, compiled language designed by Google for simplicity and performance.
A powerful general-purpose language that forms the foundation of many modern languages.
A framework developed by Microsoft for building and running applications on Windows.
A scripting language known for its strengths in text processing and system administration.
A systems programming language focused on speed, safety, and concurrency.
A hybrid functional and object-oriented language that runs on the JVM.
A client-optimized language developed by Google, often used with Flutter for app development.
An early high-level programming language, especially used in scientific computing.
A business-oriented programming language primarily used in legacy financial systems.
A purely functional programming language known for its strong type system and abstraction.
